title: Erigon BSC Mining : sync stage get a infinite loop when handle mining block
body: #### System information Erigon version: `./erigon --version` erigon version 2022.08.3-alpha-0cdee920 OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX linux Commit hash : #### Expected behaviour sync stage will catch up the latest block #### Actual behaviour sync stage stuck in stage bodies #### Steps to reproduce the behaviour #### Backtrace Add some logs ```` func (bd *BodyDownload) AddToPrefetch(block *types.Block) { if hash := types.CalcUncleHash(block.Uncles()); hash != block.UncleHash() { log.Warn("Propagated block has invalid uncles", "have", hash, "exp", block.UncleHash()) return } if hash := types.DeriveSha(block.Transactions()); hash != block.TxHash() { log.Warn("Propagated block has invalid body", "have", hash, "exp", block.TxHash()) return } --- log.Info("Add to prefetch", "block", block.Hash().Hex(), "Num", block.Number()) bd.prefetchedBlocks.Add(block) } func (bd *BodyDownload) AddMinedBlock(block *types.Block) error { ---- log.Info("AddMinedBlock", "block", block.Hash().Hex(), "Num", block.Number()) bd.AddToPrefetch(block) return nil } ```` Then I got the logs ``` [TRACE] [09-02|08:49:26.007] bodyLoop woken up by the incoming request [INFO]
